en.name: Google
criteria: Can be changed as many times as you want
Old name may appear until cache and cookies are cleared

en.name: Facebook
criteria: "Should be the name that your friends call you in everyday life"
Can only change once every 60 days
May require submitting an ID (government or non-government) to verify
May require a form to request change and confirm name

en.name: Discord
criteria: Can be changed twice an hour
Nicknames can be set at a per server level
Previous user mentions (using the @ tag) will change to reflect updated name

en.name: LinkedIn
criteria: May only be real or preferred professional name, plus preferred pronouns
Connections can see both first and last name

en.name: PayPal
criteria: Can change up to 2 characters only once after name creation, to fix misspellings
Legal or major name changes may require you to upload supporting documentation
Requires legal name as shown on government IDs

en.name: Spotify
criteria: Can only be changed on mobile platforms
Only display name can be changed, username is permanent

en.name: Steam
criteria: Records a list of previously used display names (can be cleared)

en.name: Twitter
criteria: Display name is separate from username/handle and can be changed at any time
Old handle mentions and direct messages will not change to reflect a new handle
Old username is immediately available to be used by another account

en.name: YouTube
criteria: YouTube account name will match Google account name unless using a brand account

en.name: Microsoft
criteria: Changing Microsoft account display name will also change Outlook and Windows 10

en.name: Reddit
criteria: Reddit usernames cannot be changed in any way, including things as small as capitalization
